    • Constructor Detail

      • GenericCSVInputSplit

        public GenericCSVInputSplit(int num,
                            Path file,
                            long start,
                            long length,
                            java.lang.String[] hosts)
        Constructs a split with host information.
        Parameters:
        num - the number of this input split
        file - the file name
        start - the position of the first byte in the file to process
        length - the number of bytes in the file to process (-1 is flag for "read whole file")
        hosts - the list of hosts containing the block, possibly null

      • readRecord

        public java.lang.String readRecord(java.lang.String reusable,
                                   byte[] bytes,
                                   int readOffset,
                                   int numBytes)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: DelimitedInputSplit
        This function parses the given byte array which represents a serialized record. The function returns a valid record or throws an IOException.
        Specified by:
        readRecord in class DelimitedInputSplit<java.lang.String>
        Parameters:
        reusable - An optionally reusable object.
        bytes - Binary data of serialized records.
        readOffset - The offset where to start to read the record data.
        numBytes - The number of bytes that can be read starting at the offset position.
        Returns:
        Returns the read record if it was successfully deserialized.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the record could not be read.
